alertDefProperties.name: RUM - Unusually Low Session Count
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert monitors unusually low session counts as reported through Real User Monitoring (RUM) data. A sudden drop in session volume can indicate frontend loading failures, traffic disruptions, or monitoring integration issues.

The alert is triggered when the total session count falls below a defined threshold within a specified monitoring period (e.g., 20 Minutes).

Monitoring this metric helps detect anomalies in user traffic or technical failures early, ensuring consistent data flow and user engagement visibility.

Customization Guidance:
  - Threshold: Set the threshold relative to typical session volumes, considering expected traffic patterns and time-of-day variations.
  - Monitoring Period: Choose a window that aligns with your application's usage cycles to detect meaningful deviations.
  - Notification Frequency: Configure to alert on sustained low counts or repeated drops to focus on significant anomalies.

Action: If this alert is triggered, check for frontend issues affecting RUM tracking, CDN or DNS disruptions, recent code deployments, or outages in traffic sources such as marketing campaigns or referral links.
